intro: Didymaea alsinoides var. mollis, commonly known as the softleaf didymaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
